thread.title: U.S. must 'mitigate' trade damage on American farmers -senator

title: U.S. must 'mitigate' trade damage on American farmers -senator
text:
April 4, 2018 / 4:28 PM / Updated 2 hours ago U.S. must 'mitigate' trade damage on American farmers -senator Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WASHINGTON, April 4 (Reuters) - U.S. Senator Chuck Grassley on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration over its handling of trade issues, saying while the United States should act, China’s retaliatory moves were disproportionately affecting America’s agriculture sector. 
“If the federal government takes action on trade that directly results in economic hardship for certain Americans, it has a responsibility to help those Americans and mitigate the damage it caused,” the Iowa Republican said, adding that he planned to take action in the Senate Judiciary and Finance committees. (Reporting by Susan Heavey and Kevin Drawbaugh Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
